notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 18r/1) VRVUM WEALDENDE RIHT GELYFENDVM AWORVLD aworuld minum þam leofestan hlaforde ofer ealle oðre men eorðlice kyningas alfwold

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 40v/2) Sy urum Drihtne lof ˥ wuldor ˥ wurðmynt ˥ þam eadigan were Sancte GVTHLACE on ealra worulda woruld aa buton ende on ecynysse. Amen.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The title and false attribution is an addition of s. xiii/xiv

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (40v/4) Pater noster qui es in celis sanctificetur nomen tuumadueniat regnumtuum. fiat

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Breaks of imperfectly leaving the rest of the verso blank

objectDesc.extent:
193 mm x 132 mm (dimensions of fols 18-40 - size of leaves).
152 mm x 95 mm (dimensions of fols 18-40 - size of written space).

characters.note: s low or long s used. The long s is not used at the end of a word and has a broken shaft made in two strokes.
ð has a long upstroke tagged to the left at the top, the cross-stroke not transecting the upstroke.
descenders the ends turn to the left.

binding: Nineteenth-century binding. The previous Cottonian binding included Cotton's 'armes and claspes in 4to', according to a list of Cotton's loans of books in British Library, Harley 6018, fol. 148v.
accompanying: Bound with (fols 1-17) Nennius, Historia Brittonum (s. xii)1 and (fols 41-71) Sedulius, Hymns and Carmen Paschale (s. x1?).

history.provenance: Part of the Old Royal collection, Westminster, before 1542 (Carley 1992, p. 64), then part of Laud Misc. 509. The manuscript was dismembered and rebound in its present combination by 1606, as on 20 December 1606: 'Nennius and Vita Guthlaci 8(0) was lent to Camden (British Library, Harley 6018, fol. 154r).
history.acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum along with the rest of the Cotton collection.

admin: Described by Hollie Morgan with the assistance of Sanne van der Schee; ed. by Takako Kato (2010; 2013).
